textos_fuente.text: Jannus Home Programs Economic Opportunity Agency for New Americans Economic Opportunity English Language Center Global Gardens Global Talent Idaho Office for Refugees Public Policy Idaho Out of School Network Community Health Early Head Start Empower Idaho Idaho Crisis & Suicide Hotline Aging Strong Southwest Idaho Area Health Education Center (AHEC) About Us Board Staff Financials Become a Program of Jannus Volunteer Employment Contact Events Donate Jannus is a unique health and human services organization with 13 programs operating throughout Idaho in the areas of community health, economic opportunity, and public policy. Each of our programs has a unique vision and mission serving populations from infancy to older adults – all are aligned with the overall mission of Jannus: changing lives in Idaho for the better. Community Health Our programs start with newborns and extend all the way to healthy aging for seniors. Economic opportunity We help people with few resources improve their financial health and support successful entrepreneurs. Public Policy We do in-depth analytical research and speak on behalf of those who need a voice. Jannus is structured with a centralized shared service team to provide essential services to all the programs. The Team includes executive leadership, financial expertise, human resources, grant writing and information technology. By centralizing this part of the organization, we not only offer greater efficiency, but also consistency, accountability, and compliance in many areas from complex funding requirements to human resource standards. JANNUS Impact Making a difference every day It was a snowy evening, around midnight and the phones were ringing intermittently at the Hotline. When I answered my phone, the woman’s voice on the line was shaky and tentative. Offering assurances, I let her know that we are here for her and care about her safety and well-being. As I listened to her struggles with depression and thoughts of suicide I started to understand what she was going through. She saw suicide as the only option and feared being a burden to her loved ones. As she spoke, I supported her in exploring her personal strengths and resiliency she’s demonstrated in other challenging situations. From there, I conducted a safety assessment to make sure she was not in danger. Like many people who call the Hotline, she was hesitant to reach out and concerned about taking time away from someone who may be “worse off than me.”By the end of the call, the help seeker was able to create a plan to keep herself safe and she agreed to receive a follow-up call. When the Hotline connected with her the next evening she was feeling much better and sounded calmer and relieved. She’d gotten good rest, connected with a supportive friend and spent some time at a park with her young children. As we said goodbye, she said “Thank you so much for being there for me, you saved my life.” Crisis and Suicide Hotline Responder Working Together to Improve Lives in Idaho We believe success happens when people work together, and together, we are securing the future of Jannus. We are rethinking major expenses and making changes to be more efficient. In 2024, we sold our real estate assets, invested the proceeds into a permanent endowment fund, and consolidated most programs in one leased location to improve efficiencies and the client experience. Becoming part of our life My Early Head Start journey started over seven years ago. While attending an event at the fairgrounds, I met a wonderful woman who told me all about the program. She explained all the benefits and I was convinced it would be great for me and my 18-month-old. I was assigned a wonderful home visitor who gave us encouragement and support. I learned how important my daily interactions with my children are and found social activities for our growing family. The program also gave me so many opportunities for personal growth. I joined the policy council and then served as the chair. I was a representative to the Idaho Head Start Association and a parent representative to the board. I loved serving and advocating for young children. As part of a group of Early Head Start parents that traveled to Washington, DC this year, I encouraged our congressmen and women to “Think Babies.” We encouraged our Idaho delegation to work on legislation that supports families. Today, I have five children, and I know the benefits of early childhood education first-hand, thanks to Early Head Start. And I’m still on the journey, pursuing my Early Childhood Education degree, set to graduate from the University of Idaho in May 2024. Anna JANNUS Impact Our Work is Needed as Idaho Grows We see increased pressure on families as the supply of affordable housing diminishes, child care and out-of-school programs can be unaffordable, many families are uninsured or can’t find a provider because the shortage of health care providers continues, and our aging population is in need of care. Our programs are addressing the needs of Idaho’s most vulnerable populations. Learn More → JANNUS Impact Connection provides sincere support As a Vietnam Vet, I decided to become an Aging Strong Volunteer, serving veterans of all ages. For the last several years, I have gotten to know Jim and Vikki. They moved to Idaho after losing everything in the 2018 Paradise fire. Jim, a veteran of the Korean war, suffered from dementia and Vikki, his loving wife was a full-time caregiver. I was there to give Vikki a break and bring some joy to Jim. Vickki shared, “Thank you, Aging Strong, for all that you do to help families like mine during difficult times. You sent us Webb, a unique individual with a big, beautiful heart. I didn’t know how much we needed him. He took my husband fishing, took him to lunch and an occasional dinner. Being a family caregiver doesn’t allow time for a social life. Because of Webb, I was able to be social again. My heart is full of gratitude for all that Webb offered to me and my husband. “I helped them through hard days, even Jim’s final day. That day, I was present as well as his family. I placed the flag over Jim, as he left his home for the last time. I was humbled and honored to have served this family. Webb Insights about resources to reach for the stars We are not businesswomen, but my daughter and I have a passion for people and food, especially beignets. So, the story of Ten/6 begins, and struggles in Coeur d’Alene. We needed a big “boost” educationally and financially to get our restaurant plans focused. It was our luck that we found Economic Opportunity. What we expected was a quick call with more numbers and names of someone else who ‘maybe’ could help us. To our surprise – we got a zoom meeting, with a welcoming face who wasn’t in a rush. Jessica spent over an hour with us on that first call. She was genuinely interested, asked thoughtful questions, and truly wanted to know our story. She knew right away the resources we needed and which team members to meet. We were supported, mentored, and inspired on our entrepreneurial journey. It was a game changer! From our first meeting with Jessica, to Cameo, our loan underwriter, and Mark who taught us about projections and finances – everyone helped us navigate unfamiliar territory.Now we are set to re-open this fall! “It’s hard to put into words how much the whole EO team impacted me and our business. We are forever grateful!” Jill and Taylor JANNUS Impact Jannus, Inc 3501 W. Elder Street Ste 104 Boise, ID 83705 Phone: 208-336-5533 Fax: 208-336-0880 Email: info@jannus.org Powered by Valice

Knock2 – Jannus Live Skip to content Shows VIP UPGRADE VIP Suites Table Visit About Contact Shows VIP UPGRADE VIP Suites Table Visit About Contact Instagram Facebook-f Knock2 Saturday 01 Mar / 07:00PM On sale $30 0 0 Days 0 0 Hours 0 0 Minutes 0 0 Seconds GET TICKETS JannusLive is an outdoor, STANDING ROOM ONLY venue that is committed to providing a safe and secure environment for our guests. Please review our safety and security information below PRIOR to arriving at the venue. All ticket prices are subject to increase on the day the of event. Please arrive early to the venue to allow enough time for you and your guests to move through the queue and enter the venue. Prior to entering the venue, guests will be searched (wand and/or pat-downs) to ensure that none of the restricted items enters the courtyard We suggest you leave valuable and unnecessary items at home. You may be asked to empty your pockets of all items so that they can be examined. All alcohol and narcotic laws will be strictly enforced. All bags will be searched, and no large bags or backpacks will be allowed (larger than a standard sheet of paper). We reserve the right to refuse entry to anyone. If you see something that concerns you, please say something to our management or security so we can ensure the best experience possible Restricted Items: Considering recent events, the following items are strictly prohibited No guns, knives, weapons, pepper spray, projectiles of any kind, or any other item that could be used to inflict harm. Replicas of weapons are also NOT permitted No large purses, bags or backpacks will be allowed (larger than a standard sheet of paper). No drugs, drug paraphernalia, or illegal substances of any kind No outside food or drinks No blankets, lawn chairs and/or any other personal furniture, please see FAQs for email info@jannuslive.com or questions regarding ADA No umbrellas, Jannus Live is an outdoor venue, so please plan accordingly No personal video cameras, Go-Pros, selfie sticks, drones, masks or laser pointers. No professional audio, video, or audio recording equipment – (including detachable lenses, tripods, zooms or commercial use rigs) For press pass access, please contact the artist or their management directly. No pet, please see our FAQs or email info@jannuslive.com for questions regarding service animals This list of prohibited items is subject to change at the discretion of venue management Other Important Rules for our Venue We are an outdoor, STANDING ROOM ONLY venue All tickets are considered General Admission, unless specifically noted VIP. If your ticket was purchased from either Ticketmaster or AXS.com, they may print with a seat number. This is something we cannot control on their printed tickets and is not a real seat. Jannus Live does not have seating of any kind. All shows are considered ALL-AGES unless specifically noted on the website or flyer, however we always recommend parental discretion based on the artist content and our bar-like environment. Jannus Live does not have a specific ADA section, however we are 100% wheel chair accessible and allow for certain types of medical equipment to be used in the venue. For specific questions please email info@jannuslive.com All concerts are considered RAIN OR SHINE, with the exception of extremely severe weather. Cancellations due to weather are rare and are announced as early as possible via this website and social media. Please note, UMBRELLAS are prohibited, but we do sell ponchos! Whispers of The Pelican in Notting Hill investigated... - Hospitality & Catering News Latest News Restaurant News Hotel News Catering News Chef News Pub & Bar News Supplier News Hospitality & Catering News hospitality and catering news Whispers of The Pelican in Notting Hill investigated… June 9, 2022 By Denis Sheehan, Publisher, H&C News: Whispers of The Pelican in Notting Hill investigated… We have heard a few whispers that The Pelican in Notting Hill is fast becoming a haunt frequented by the great and good of the food world, so we asked someone in the know for more info… The Pelican has been a pub in Notting Hill on All Saints Road since 1870, but was recently acquired by new owners and, following a full restoration and soft opening period, it has relaunched as a pub and dining room. Restaurateur James Gummer, along with co-owners Phil Winser and Richard Squire, and Head Chef Owen Kenworthy, have redesigned and refurbished the site to create what they describe as “a place that becomes a cornerstone of the local community, not just somewhere to eat and drink”. Owen Kenworthy’s background is impressively broad, ranging from The Wolseley and Sketch to Primeur and Brawn, where he was Head Chef alongside Ed Wilson when it opened in 2010. His cooking style is rustic, modern executions of classic British and European cuisine. The focus is on the finest British produce, with sustainability also a fundamental priority, and engaging suppliers who use regenerative farming methods, where possible. Typical dishes on the dining room menu include: Raw beef with Gentleman’s Relish, Ham hock with egg mayo, Potted shrimp, Onglet and shallot, and Lobster and monkfish pie with lobster head gravy. Various cuts of beef are butchered on-site, and a ‘5th Quarter Pie’ makes use of the offal.  Desserts include Lemon posset with shortbread; and Ginger Parkin and custard, made with Owen’s family recipe. The pub offering is more casual with options such as Mince on toast; Welsh rarebit; Sausage roll; and Spider crab toast. A wide selection of British beers includes Allsopp’s IPA, Portobello Pilsner, and Deya.  In addition to classic cocktails and a concise 40-bin wine list (glasses from £5/bottles from £25), a constantly evolving single bottle wine list is available. James Gummer – who oversees the day-to-day operations – also owns 7 Saints restaurant, located further down All Saints Road, which opened in 2018.  His career in hospitality began at The Smile in New York, followed by roles at The Wolseley and the Santa Cruz group’s Isabel in Mayfair.  Fellow co-founder Phil Winser recently returned to London from New York, where he spent the last 12 years operating the Silkstone Group and hugely successful The Fat Radish (including co-writing The Fat Radish Kitchen Diaries). The dining room accommodates up to 48, while the pub/bar area can seat 40 (16 of those in a small section by the fireplace), and up to 24 outdoors, with license for standing drinkers. The Pelican Room on the upper level – for private hire and events – can seat up to 30, and has its own bar.  The understated design throughout – devised by the three owners – features warm lighting and cosy tan leather banquettes, original fireplaces, and antique furniture. Enthusing about the objectives of The Pelican to play a vital role in the neighbourhood, James Gummer stated: “We want it to be fun for our guests to join us for not only dining and drinking, but also for any of the planned regular events and activities in the building, from film and jazz nights, to boxing, bridge and pilates classes.” Aiming to create a ‘town hall’ environment for the surrounding community, the team opens up the Pelican Room to local council meetings and the Tavistock Gardens Residents’ Association. The Pelican also sponsors the Rugby Portobello Under 12s, a team at the local Football Academy funded by the Rugby Portobello Trust. We might ask the same ‘someone in the know’ if they could arrange for a table soon, if so full report to follow, the Onglet and shallot looks a must. CURRENT OPENING HOURS The Pelican is open daily THE DINING ROOM: Lunch Saturday and Sunday Noon-3.30pm Dinner Monday-Saturday 6pm-10pm; Sunday 6pm-9pm THE PUB:  Monday-Thursday 5pm-Midnight; Friday-Saturday Noon-Midnight; Sunday Noon-10.30pm (Bar menu available throughout pub opening hours) The Pelican – 45 All Saints Road, London W11 1HE Telephone – 020 4537 2880, or Email – bookings@thepelicanw11.com Website – www.thepelicanw11.com  Instagram – @thepelican_w11 Zest Quest Asia announced beneficiary of the H&C News Golf Day in association with Meiko UK Email Newsletter Subscribe to our email newsletter and keep a close eye on the UK hospitality and catering business Search h&C NEWS Facebook Twitter Join our email newsletter community here Supplier News Condensation, Damp and Mould: The Hidden Autumn Hazards in Commercial Kitchens Kitchen Porter of the Month recognising an array of talent from across our industry Riso Gallo Celebrates National Rice Week with Sustainability, Quality, and Kitchen-Ready Innovation Transforming Accessible Tourism Thai Sweet Chilli Sauce Joins Country Range’s Sauce Assortment Wafflemeister Partners With TRGC for First Airport Opening Country Range Store Cupboard Enhanced With Addition of Multi-Use Tomato Sauce HEWI Joins Accessible Hospitality Alliance as Sponsor Partner, Deepening Commitment to Accessible Design Hyde London City Unveils Adaptogenic Iced Coffee Collaboration with London Nootropics HancNews News Categories Latest News Restaurant News Hotel News Catering News Chef News Pub & Bar News Supplier News Home | Privacy | Sitemap Copyright © · Hospitality & Catering News

From Port of Miami: By Car: Head west on Port Boulevard. Continue onto I-395 W. Merge onto MacArthur Causeway. Turn left onto Collins Avenue. Turn right onto 8th Street. Continue onto Ocean Drive. Pelican Hotel will be on your left at 826 Ocean Drive. By Public Transportation: Unfortunately, there is no direct public transportation route from the Port of Miami. A taxi or rideshare service would be recommended. From Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport (FLL): By Car: Take I-595 E from the airport. Merge onto I-95 S toward Miami. Take exit 4 toward I-195 E/Miami Beach. Continue onto W 41st Street/Arthur Godfrey Road. Turn right onto Indian Creek Drive. Continue onto Collins Avenue. Turn left onto 8th Street. Continue onto Ocean Drive. Pelican Hotel will be on your left at 826 Ocean Drive. By Public Transportation: Take the Tri-Rail Shuttle to Fort Lauderdale Airport Station. Board the Tri-Rail train heading south to the Metrorail Transfer Station. Transfer to the Orange Line of Miami-Dade Metrorail heading towards Dadeland South. Get off at Government Center Station and transfer to the Southbound C Local Metrobus. Get off at 9th Street & Washington Avenue. Walk east on 9th Street towards Ocean Drive. Turn left on Ocean Drive, and Pelican Hotel will be on your right. Remember to check for any updates or changes in transportation options, and consider traffic conditions when traveling by car. Safe travels! Check-in – 4:00 PM Check-out – 11:00 AM Internet – Free WiFi is available in all areas of the hotel. Resort Fee – There is a service fee of $38.00 per night. Plus tax Parking – The parking fee is $42 per night before taxes. Unlimited in/out access Eligible Age to check-in – 21 years Pets are welcome! – We allow one dog 30lbs or under. There is a fee of $25 per night plus a onetime clean up fee of $150.00 *Pet reservations must be re approved by the hotel prior to arrival. Children – Children 12 sleeping in the same bed as parents stay free. Children Over 12 pay 3 rd occupancy rate plus extra bed rate. Extra Beds & Cribs – Rollaway beds in approved rooms subject to availability. $75 per day. Cribs are available, subject to availability and carry a rental fee of $75.00 per stay. Smoking – Our hotel is 100% non-smoking, sorry, no smoking is allowed. Guest Payment Options – We accept American Express, Visa, Euro/Mastercard, and Discover cards. Guest Information Required for Reservations and at Check-in: Guests will be required to provide a valid ID and at check-in.‍ All guests staying in the hotel must be registered with the front desk. Credit/Debit Card Pre-authorizations & Charges: Guest credit cards will be pre-authorized and charged for the first night room and tax prior to arrival. Credit/Debit Card Charges at Check-in: A $300 deposit will be held on the credit card provided at check in to cover incidental charges and damage upon check-in, and it will be released back to the same payment method at check out Cancellation policies: We offer free cancellations up to 72 hours prior to arrival, but early departures within this window are non-refundable. Please note that non-refundable rates are, as the name suggests, non-refundable. We’re excited to welcome you to the Pelican Hotel in the heart of Miami Beach! To ensure a smooth and enjoyable arrival experience, please take note of the following details: Address Information: Pelican Hotel 826 Ocean Drive Miami Beach, FL 33139 Tel: 305-673-3373 Check-In Time: Check-In Time: 4:00 PM EST. Please note that we cannot guarantee early check-in. To ensure access to guest rooms for guests traveling overnight, we recommend booking the night prior to facilitate early room availability. As a courtesy, the hotel will hold your bags on your day of arrival until your room is ready for check-in, allowing you time to explore the city. Check-Out Time: Check-Out Time: 11:00 AM EST. We regret that we cannot guarantee late check-out due to incoming guests. However, we would be pleased to hold your bags until you are ready to depart for the airport, port, or next destination. Please note that we do not hold bags once you have checked out of the hotel. Parking: For guests arriving by car, we offer valet parking at the Pelican Hotel for $42.00 per day with in/out services. Please approach the hotel entrance upon arrival, and our valet attendants will assist you with parking arrangements. Airport Transportation: For guests arriving at Miami International Airport (MIA) or Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport (FLL), or Ports, we recommend transportation options such as taxis, ride-sharing services, and rental cars. Please contact our concierge team for assistance and pricing with arranging private limo airport transportation in advance. Special Requests: We strive to accommodate our guests needs and preferences to ensure a memorable stay. If you have any special requests or require additional assistance during your arrival, please inform us in advance, and we’ll do our best to accommodate you. We look forward to welcoming you and making your stay with us unforgettable! Welcome to the Pelican Hotel Miami Beach! To make your stay even more enjoyable, here are some convenient transportation options for exploring the vibrant city of Miami Beach. Public Transportation Miami-Dade Transit (MDT): The Miami-Dade Transit system offers extensive bus routes and Metrorail services throughout the city. Bus stops are conveniently run along Collins Avenue and Washington Avenue, providing easy access to the Government Center Metrorail station in downtown Miami. Metrorail: Metrorail is a rapid transit system serving Miami-Dade County with convenient connections to downtown Miami and other major destinations (like the speed train to Orlando) From Government Center Metrorail Station, you can also take the Metrorail Orange line towards Miami International Airport (MIA) Disembark at the next stop, Miami Central Station Take the Brightline train to Orlando Additionally, keep in mind that transportation options and schedules may change, so it’s best to verify the current information closer to your travel date. Hop-on-Hop-off: The Red Bus is a popular hop-on hop-off tour service that allows visitors to discover Miami Beach, Little Havana, Wynwood, Coconut Grove and other top attractions. The buses are double-decker, providing great views of the city as you travel. Passengers can hop on and off at any designated stops along the route, making it easy to explore different areas of Miami Beach. See the concierge for pricing. Free Rides and Shuttle Services Freebee: Freebee offers on-demand, eco-friendly transportation within specific areas of Miami Beach. Download the Freebee app to request a ride and enjoy complimentary transportation to nearby attractions, restaurants, and shops. Miami Beach Trolley: The Miami Beach Trolley is a free transportation option that connects popular destinations within Miami Beach, including South Beach, North Beach, and Mid-Beach. Look for the nearest trolley stop close to the Pelican Hotel to hop on board and explore the area hassle-free. Additional Transportation Options Ride-Sharing Apps: Utilize popular ride-sharing apps like Uber and Lyft for convenient door-to-door transportation around Miami Beach. Simply request a ride through the app, and a driver will pick you up at the Pelican Hotel and take you to your desired destination. Bicycle Rentals: CitiBikes Conveniently located across the street with numerous dock stations around Miami Beach.  The solar-powered bike sharing system consists of a fleet of specially designed, sturdy, very durable bikes that are locked into a network of docking stations sited at regular intervals around a city. With 160+ station locations and more on the way, bikes are available to use 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. There are two distinct ways to utilize the Citi Bike program, Hourly Rental. Explore Miami Beach at your own pace. Accessibility Commitment at Pelican Hotel At Pelican Hotel, we are dedicated to ensuring that our website is accessible to all individuals, regardless of their circumstances and abilities. Our commitment extends to conforming with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.0, Level AA) set forth by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). Guiding Principles The WCAG guidelines provide a comprehensive framework for enhancing web content accessibility, specifically designed to accommodate users with disabilities. We strive to align our website closely with these principles to create an inclusive and user-friendly online environment. Ongoing Efforts While we work diligently to uphold accessibility standards throughout www.pelicanhotel.com, we acknowledge that achieving perfection in every aspect can be challenging. Our team is actively engaged in an ongoing effort to address any areas where compliance may be currently lacking. Dynamic Nature of the Website Please be aware that our website is dynamic and regularly updated to provide fresh and relevant content. Due to this dynamic nature, minor accessibility issues may occasionally arise. Rest assured, we are committed to promptly identifying and rectifying any such issues as they occur. Continuous Improvement Pelican Hotel is dedicated to ensuring that every section of our website attains the highest level of web accessibility. We are continually exploring and implementing solutions to elevate the overall accessibility of our site, fostering an inclusive online experience for all users. Your Feedback Matters Your input is invaluable to us. If you have any comments or suggestions regarding the accessibility of our site, please do not hesitate to contact our accessibility coordinator. You can reach us via email at reservation@pelicanhotel.com or by phone at 305-673-3373. Your feedback plays a crucial role in our ongoing efforts to enhance accessibility, and we appreciate your assistance in making our website more accessible for everyone. Thank you for choosing Pelican Hotel. animals ACCESSIBILITY Jannus Live is a standing-room-only concert venue , which means we do not have seating available and cannot permit personal chairs to be brought into the venue. However, we are fully wheelchair accessible. While we understand that you may not typically use such items, they could be a safe and practical option if you need to rest during the event. Below is a list of mobility devices that are permitted as reasonable accommodations under our standing-room-only policy: -Walkers (with or without a seat) -Rollators (with or without a seat) -Canes (with or without a seat) -Crutches -Wheelchairs -Power wheelchairs -Mobility scooters Please note, in accordance with ADA regulations, if you are using a cart or powered mobility device, while we won’t inquire about the specifics of your disability, we may request “credible assurance” of its use for accessibility. This could include: -A valid, state-issued disability parking placard. -Other state-issued proof of disability. -A personal statement affirming its use for a disability (unless behavior contradicts this statement). If you have further questions or need assistance, feel free to contact Megan Barnes directly at megan@jannuslive.com . FAQ Q. What is your camera policy? The standard venue policy allows camera phones, disposable cameras, and small digital cameras. Any camera with a detachable lens or a lens that extends more than 1 inch will be considered professional and is not permitted. Some artists may have specific restrictions, so please check for the show you will be attending. Q. What is your COVID-19 policy? Currently, there are no restrictions or mandates for guests to wear masks, social distance, present a negative COVID test, or show proof of vaccination. Q. Do you have seating? Jannus Live is an outdoor standing room only venue with no seating permitted. For questions related to ADA accessibility, please email info@jannuslive.com. Q. What are your office hours? Monday to Friday from 11 am to 6 pm. For a more timely response, please email info@jannuslive.com. Q. How do I purchase tickets? We strongly recommend purchasing tickets through our promoter-approved websites directly from the link (red box marked “TICKETS”) on www.jannuslive.com to ensure correct pricing and genuine tickets. We do not recommend purchasing tickets from other websites and cannot be responsible for their validity, pricing, or refund policy. Q. Can I purchase tickets over the phone or at your box office? Jannus Live does not have a daily box office. On the day of each concert, will call will open 15-30 minutes prior to the scheduled gate opening time. If tickets still remain for purchase, they will be sold here. For questions on purchasing tickets in advance, please email info@jannuslive.com. Q. Where do I pick up my will call tickets? Our will call window is located at the main entrance (2nd St N). This window typically opens a little before gates (roughly 15-30 minutes), based on the particular concert. Please bring your photo ID and the credit card you used to purchase the tickets. Q. Can you scan tickets from a mobile phone? We recommend printing out your tickets to expedite the entry process. However, we can accept electronic tickets from your phone. The original emailed barcode (not a screenshot) is recommended in case backup is needed for tickets that do not scan. Upon arrival, please ensure your email is open, with the ticket barcode showing, and your phone brightness is at the highest setting. Q. Can I refund my tickets? All tickets are final sale. In the rare case a concert is canceled, your tickets will be automatically refunded from your point of purchase (this applies to promoter-approved, online sales only). Jannus Live cannot control refunds for tickets purchased from unknown ticketing sources. For specific questions regarding refunds, please email info@jannuslive.com. Q. Are you wheelchair accessible? Jannus Live does not have an exclusive ADA section but is 100% wheelchair accessible and allows other types of medical equipment in the venue. For specific questions, please email info@jannuslive.com. Q. Are you an all-ages venue? All shows are considered “all ages” unless otherwise indicated on our website. However, we encourage parental discretion based on the artist’s performance/content and our bar-like environment where patrons have the option to drink and smoke cigarettes. We also encourage you to consider the volume of music played if your child is of a younger age. We do not enforce, but encourage, headphones be worn by any child under 5 years of age. Q. Do young children require a ticket for entry? The promoter of each show determines this rule for their specific concert. For entry requirements for a specific show, please email info@jannuslive.com. Q. Do you allow pets into the venue? We do not allow pets of any kind into the venue for the safety of themselves and other guests. Service animals are allowed but not recommended unless absolutely necessary due to the volume of music and capacity of guests, which could be overwhelming. For specific questions regarding service animals, please email info@jannuslive.com. Q. Do you have an ATM on the property? Yes, we have two ATMs on site for your convenience. The first is located just outside the gates, next to will call (please use this before entry), and a second is located at the back of the venue. Q. Does the show still go on if it rains? All concerts are considered rain or shine, with the exception of extremely severe weather. Cancellations due to weather are rare and are announced as early as possible via our website and social media. Please note, umbrellas are prohibited, but we do sell ponchos. Q. Can I bring my own drinks and food into the venue? No outside food or beverages, including water, are permitted inside the venue. Jannus Live provides many full-service liquor and beer bars throughout (that accept cash and credit cards), as well as a pizza stand provided by Joey Brooklyn’s Famous Pizza Kitchen. Q. Can I bring a camera into the venue? DSLRs, GoPros, and/or video cameras are strictly prohibited by the venue unless permission is granted. For press pass access, please contact the artists or their management directly. Q. What items are prohibited from the venue? The following items are strictly prohibited inside Jannus Live: weapons of any kind; backpacks, oversized bags, or large purses (larger than a standard sheet of paper); laser pens; signs; banners; food; beverages; drugs; alcohol; umbrellas; or any type of glass. Jannus Live and our security team are not responsible for any of these items left at the gate or confiscated upon entry. Please leave anything you would like to keep in your possession at home or in your vehicle. For additional information, please visit the Information page on our website or email info@jannuslive.com. Make a Payment 📱 or Skip a Payment 📱 To make a payment from a Pelican checking or savings account: Login to MyPelican and select "Transfers." There, you can transfer money easily between Pelican accounts. To make a p ayment from another institution: Login to MyPelican and select "Accounts." Click the + icon to add an external savings or checking account from another bank or credit union. Keep in mind that setting up a new external account can take up to 2-3 business days. Once the external account is set up, select "Transfers" in the menu to make a payment to your Pelican loan or credit card. We've upgraded our Online Payment Center for you to make recurring Pelican loan payments for FREE! Of course, you can always bring cash into a Pelican branch near you. Skip the line and enroll in the Online Payment Center today! To skip a payment: For just $40 per loan , you can skip your next qualifying payment if your loan(s) meet all of the requirements. To skip your payment, login to MyPelican and select "Skip-A-Pay" in the menu. MyPelican will only show you loans that are eligible for this service. Loan Reminder Team If you are past due on your payments, you may receive a phone call from Pelican's loan reminder team at (866) 536-2435 to see how we can assist you. Learn More Balance Inquiries 📱 MyPelican : Check account balances by logging into MyPelican. All accounts and their balances are listed at the top of the screen. Phone: Check account balances by calling 1-800-351-4877. Get Your Full Account Number(s) 📱 Where to find full account numbers: Checks - Your full account number is located at the bottom of your checks. MyPelican - Simply select the account and look for the account number under "Details." Is my member number the same as my account number? No. Do not use your member number to set up direct deposit or ACH payments. If you do, it will be returned. You should only use your member number when contacting us so we can look up your account. Checking Your Online Membership Application? We’re here to help! If you’ve recently applied for membership online and want to check the status of your application, log in to your application here or give us a call at 1-800-351-4877 . Our friendly team is ready to assist you and answer any questions you may have. At Pelican, you're more than just a member—you're family! Activate a New Card & PIN Change 📱 MyPelican : Select the account that the card is associated with, choose "Card management," and click or tap "Activate new card." Phone: Activate your new card by calling 1-800-351-4877 and selecting menu option #2 - Debit and Credit Cards. You can change your card PIN by calling 1-800-351-4877 and selecting menu option #2 - Debit and Credit Cards. Report a Lost or Stolen Card 📱 MyPelican: Select the account that the card is associated with, choose "Card management," and click or tap "Report lost/stolen." Keep in mind that once this is done, you cannot reactivate the card within the app. If you've simply misplaced your card, you can temporarily disable it by using the on/off toggle. Phone: Call 1-800-351-4877 and select menu option #2 - Debit and Credit Cards. This is available 24/7. Dispute a Transaction If you need to dispute a debit or credit card transaction, including ATM withdrawals conducted at non-Pelican ATMs, have your card number ready and follow these steps: Contact the Merchant: A majority of billing errors can be resolved in the most efficient manner by contacting the merchant directly. Should the merchant be unwilling or unable to correct the transaction, or if you do not recognize the charge, we’re here to provide additional assistance. Prepare and File: Before initiating your dispute, gather all supporting documentation, such as receipts, proof of return, copies of communication with the merchant, or any other information relevant to your dispute case. Call 888-330-1011 to begin the process. Keep in Touch: Our team may require further details from you and reach out to you directly. It is crucial to promptly review and respond to their message. For any other dispute type, please message us in MyPelican or call us at 1-800-351-4877. When will I be reimbursed for my disputed charge? You will receive communication within 15 days of the day your dispute was filed, letting you know whether we will be able to reimburse you or not. May I keep my current card? In situations where there was a billing error, you'll be able to keep your card. In cases of fraudulent or unrecognized charges, your card must be blocked immediately. A new card and number will be issued to you prevent to further unauthorized charges. What can I expect after filing a dispute? We may need additional information about your transaction while we conduct our investigation. Please be on the lookout for communication from us and respond as soon as possible. How long does the dispute process take? The process may take between 60 to 120 days. If the dispute is found in your favor, you'll receive communication that your case has been closed and the provisional credit will remain in your account permanently. If we receive a merchant response with supporting evidence that the charge was legitimate, we will send a copy for you to review. If this occurs, you can respond and send additional information to us for further review. File a Credit Life/Credit Disability Claim Credit Disability In your time of need, our claims process is quick and easy. If you elected payment protection on your loan, you can use this convenient claims process to quickly and easily file your disability claim. File Your Claim To check on the status of a claim, call 1-800-621-6323. Credit Life To file a Credit Life claim, please call us at 1-800-351-4877. Don't forget to have your date of disability handy when filing your claim! Your disability date is the last day that you worked, your injury date, or your diagnosis date. However, another Zelle user can send funds to the newly enrolled account immediately. For detailed answers to other most frequently asked Zelle questions, such as payment limits and enrollment, click here . To speak directly with Zelle customer support, call 1-844-428-8542. Collateral Protection Insurance (CPI) Notice Why did I receive a Collateral Protection Insurance Notice? One of the conditions of your loan agreement is that you're required to maintain comprehensive and collision coverage on your vehicle as long as you have a loan with Pelican. If you're receive a notice from us, that's because we have not received proof that you have acceptable insurance coverage. In order to prove you have the proper comprehensive and collision coverage needed, we need you to provide us with information outlined in your insurance policy, which includes showing Pelican Credit Union as the lienholder and the amount of your deductible. Please note that an insurance card is not an acceptable proof of insurance. What happens if I haven't submitted proof of insurance to Pelican? If we don't receive proof of insurance that meets the requirements outlined in your loan agreement, Collateral Protection Insurance (CPI) may be issued to you through Pelican's insurance program. This coverage is intended to protect Pelican's interests and will not meet the requirements of any financial responsibility law or provide liability coverage to you. How do I submit my proof of insurance to Pelican? If you've received a notice from us, it's simple to submit your insurance information to us quickly and securely online, or you can always submit proof via mail or fax. To email your proof of insurance, please email the policy as an attachment to pelicanstatecu@imcovered.com . To mail your proof of insurance, please send your policy to: Pelican Credit Union P.O. Box 690267 San Antonio, TX 78269-0267 To fax your proof of insurance, please send your policy to (877) 935-3967. For any other questions regarding Pelican's insurance program, please call (833) 921-8093. The Brief Jannus Live owner, Jeffry Knight, is stepping down from his position with the concert venue days after the deadly Clearwater Ferry crash. A statement was released by Jannus Live on Wednesday that said the "decision was made out of respect for the victims." A Palm Harbor father of two died in the crash and 10 other passengers on the ferry were injured. CLEARWATER, Fla. - Days after the deadly Clearwater Ferry crash, Jannus Live owner, Jeffry Knight, is stepping down from his position with the popular St. Petersburg concert venue. Knight was the operator of the recreational boat that crashed into the Clearwater Ferry Sunday evening near the Memorial Causeway Bridge. It left Palm Harbor father of two, Jose Castro, dead and 10 others injured. Pictured: Scene after the Clearwater Ferry crash on Sunday evening. PREVIOUS: Clearwater Ferry crash: Jannus Live releases statement on owner's involvement in deadly incident Jannus Live on Jeffry Knight stepping down What they're saying: Jannus Live released the following statement on Instagram Wednesday afternoon: "Effective immediately, Jeff Knight is stepping down from his position at Jannus Live and will no longer have any affiliation with the venue. This decision was made out of respect for the victims of the recent Clearwater Ferry tragedy and to ensure that ongoing developments do not detract from the work of talented artists, staff, and community partners who have long contributed to the success of Jannus Live. Jannus Live will continue normal operations under its existing management team with a renewed focus on delivering world-class live entertainment to the St. Petersburg community." Follow FOX 13 on YouTube Clearwater Ferry crash latest What we know: Officials said the Clearwater Ferry crash happened near the Memorial Causeway Bridge, which connects downtown Clearwater to Clearwater Beach. The crash happened between 8:30 p.m. and 8:40 p.m. on Sunday when a recreational boat slammed into the ferry. The Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission said more than 40 people were on board the Clearwater Ferry at the time of the crash, and six people were on board the 37-foot recreational boat. RELATED: Clearwater Ferry crash: Jannus Live owner’s attorney addresses ‘misinformation’ as investigation unfolds Video released by the Clearwater Police Department showed the moment the recreational boat rammed into the ferry. Video: Boat crashes into Clearwater Ferry The Clearwater Police Department released video of a boat crashing into the Clearwater Ferry Sunday evening. The crash left 1 person dead and 10 others injured. Courtesy: Clearwater Police Department. First responders with FWC, CPD, the Clearwater Fire Department, the Pinellas County Sheriff's Office and the United States Coast Guard all responded to the crash to help passengers, secure the scene and begin their investigation into what they deemed a "mass casualty event." What we don't know: While authorities said their investigation will take time, no arrests have been made in the crash. PREVIOUS: Clearwater Ferry crash: 1 dead and 10 hospitalized, boat involved located Dig deeper: FWC investigators said they spoke with Knight after the crash, and he and all the passengers on the recreational boat were cooperative with the investigation. Knight even did a voluntary breathalyzer test, which came back with a reading of zero. Authorities said the investigation into the Clearwater Ferry crash remains active. The FWC is now looking for any video footage from the area where the crash happened. If you have any video from the area between 8 p.m. and 8:45 p.m. on Sunday, you're asked to contact the Wildlife Alert Hotline at 888-404-3922. Letter from Knight's attorney The other side: In a letter sent to investigators and obtained by FOX 13 on Tuesday, Knight’s attorney aimed to address what he described as "misinformation" surrounding the incident , particularly claims that Knight left the crash scene. The letter reads, in part: "Immediately after the accident, Mr. Knight directed a passenger on his vessel to call 911, and that passenger remained on the line with 911 for 12 minutes… Mr. Knight tied his vessel to the ferry in order to stabilize it and render aid. He used his boat to maneuver the ferry closer to shore so that first responders would have easier access to the passengers." READ: Family of Clearwater Ferry crash victim mourns loss as investigation continues: ‘We need justice’ The letter goes on to say Knight "told the captain of the ferry boat he was able to transport injured individuals by water to Morton Plant Hospital … this offer was declined." The attorney said Knight only departed when emergency responders arrived, and his boat began taking on too much water. Knight's boating history The backstory: According to court records, this isn't the only boating incident that Knight has been involved in over the years. "My clients were in a pontoon boat along with two other passengers, and out of nowhere, Mr. Knight just plowed his vessel right through my client's pontoon boat," Brandon Volk, a maritime attorney out of South Florida, said. Volk said he represented clients in a civil lawsuit against Knight after a boating incident in 2019. According to the lawsuit, Knight crashed into a pontoon boat near the Dick Misener Bridge in St. Pete. Court records claim that Knight admitted to looking down leading up to the crash. What they're saying: "There were a lot of similarities between these two incidents," Volk said. Volk said his clients were injured and taken to the hospital after the crash, but nobody was killed. The lawsuit ended in a confidential settlement. "Our waters in Florida, they should be safe, and you shouldn't be plowing your boats through other boats in the state of Florida," Volk said. The Source: The information in this story was gathered using details from Wednesday's statement posted on Jannus Live's Instagram. It also includes previous information from investigators on the Clearwater Ferry crash as well as previous details gathered by FOX 13's Evyn Moon and Kylie Jones.
